page.title: 14Pets.
page.content: The English have somehow won a name for being animal lovers. The children of Grange Junior School carried out a survey to see how true this is so far as Tuffley is concerned. About 200 families are represented in the School and 176 of them keep at least one pet. It was expected that cats and dogs would be at the top of the list. There were 111 cats and 82 dogs, but the greatest number was reported for birds (127). Of the "traditional" pets, rabbits (50), guinea pigs (33) and hamsters (27) came next. The less usual pets noted included snakes, tarantulas, crabs, terrapins, ponies and a frog. Did the family calling their two eels pets, first catch them as elvers - and then had second thoughts about frying them?
